text:
Thomas M. Tunney (born August 22, 1955) is an American entrepreneur and politician. He has been an alderman on the Chicago City Council since 2003. He represents the prominent 44th Ward of the city.
Tunney thought about running for mayor in 2019, but did not and endorsed Lori Lightfoot.
In May 2019, Mayor Lightfoot picked Tunney as Vice Mayor.
Tunney was the first openly gay Chicago Alderman.
